content: The "Seniors' Retirement Recovery Act of 2005" repeals the 1993 income tax increase on Social Security benefits. Benefits paid after December 31, 2005, and tax liabilities for taxable years beginning after the same date are affected by the amendments. Appropriations to the Hospital Insurance Trust Fund are made to offset revenue reductions caused by the Act, with transfers mimicking what would have occurred without the Act. The Secretary of the Treasury or delegate must report annually to the House Ways and Means Committee and Senate Finance Committee on transfers made under this subsection. The age for beginning mandatory distributions has been increased to 80. Amendments to section 457 Plans now require distributions to start at age 80 instead of 70 1/2. These changes apply to distributions after the enactment of the Act.
